When asked by another inmate whether he will miss the company of women, his reply (the last line of the novel) is quite different from Harry’s last line: “Women, shit,” the tall convict said.

Faulkner began composing The Wild Palms and Old Man as two separate stories but soon realized that the narratives were related to each other, not by plot and character but by theme and image. Both stories are about freedom versus imprisonment, the disorder of life versus the security of incarceration.
